metadata.title: CVE-2024-26773 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ext4: avoid allocating blocks from corrupted group inext4_mb_try_best_found()Determine if the group block bitmap is corrupted before using ac_b_ex inext4_mb_try_best_found() to avoid allocating blocks from a group with acorrupted block bitmap in the following concurrency and making thesituation worse.ext4_mb_regular_allocator  ext4_lock_group(sb, group)  ext4_mb_good_group   // check if the group bbitmap is corrupted  ext4_mb_complex_scan_group   // Scan group gets ac_b_ex but doesn't use it  ext4_unlock_group(sb, group)                           ext4_mark_group_bitmap_corrupted(group)                           // The block bitmap was corrupted during                           // the group unlock gap.  ext4_mb_try_best_found    ext4_lock_group(ac->ac_sb, group)    ext4_mb_use_best_found      mb_mark_used      // Allocating blocks in block bitmap corrupted group

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
